strategy.trend_analysis: The hashtag strategy incorporates current trends such as the popularity of educational content on platforms like TikTok (#LearnOnTikTok, #EduTok), visually appealing content (#MathIsArt), and relatable learning struggles (#StudyHacks). The inclusion of #FamilyGuyStyle and #AnimatedSeries taps into broader entertainment trends, aiming to attract a wider audience interested in the show's format and humor. The overall approach balances niche, topic-specific tags with broader, trending, and engagement-driving tags for maximum reach and interaction on Instagram.
strategy.engagement_strategy: Engagement is driven by asking questions (#WhatDoYouThink), inviting interaction (#AskMeAnything), and fostering a positive community around learning (#ShareTheKnowledge, #MathIsCool). The combination of entertaining (comedy, animation) and educational content naturally encourages discussion and sharing among viewers. Primary and niche hashtags also serve to attract a dedicated audience who are more likely to engage with the content.

usage_tips: For Instagram, aim for a mix of popular, niche, and specific hashtags. You can use up to 30 hashtags per post. Consider placing them in the first comment to keep your caption clean.
Vary your hashtag usage across posts to test which combinations perform best. Monitor your Instagram Insights to see which hashtags are driving the most impressions.
While targeting Instagram, cross-pollinate relevant trending tags from other platforms like TikTok (#EduTok) if they have broad appeal and aren't overly platform-specific.
Engage with users who use similar educational or niche hashtags to build community and increase visibility.
Consider creating a unique hashtag for your series (#DragonDetectiveAgency) and encouraging viewers to use it when discussing the content.

generation_metadata.topic: EPISODE 13: Dragon Detective Agency!! Show this as HUGE ANIMATED TITLE CARD at the beginning for 3 seconds with epic effects! Create a Family Guy style comedy where dragon detective investigates functions completely. Teach systematic function analysis: finding domain, critical points, using first and second derivative tests, finding inflection points, asymptotes, and sketching curves. Use visual metaphors: detective investigation, solving cases, mood swings for concavity. Make the complete function investigation process entertaining and memorable.
